LAS VEGAS--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Jan 6, 2020-- Breakthroughs in artificial intelligence (AI) that pave the way for autonomous driving.
A new era of mobile computing innovation.
The future of immersive sports and entertainment.

Intel demonstrated all of these and more today at CES 2020, showcasing how the company is infusing intelligence across the cloud, network, edge and PC, and driving positive impact for people, business and society.
This press release features multimedia.

View the full release here: <a class="" href="https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20200106006026/en/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"   <media class="inline:reference" media-type="image" At CES 2020 in Las Vegas, Intel previewed a foldable OLED display form factor, code-named “Horseshoe Bend.” Based on Intel’s upcoming Tiger Lake mobile processors, the design is similar in size to a 12-inch laptop with a folding touchscreen display that can be opened up to more than 17 inches.

(Credit: Walden Kirsch/Intel Corporation) Intel CEO Bob Swan kicked off today’s news conference by sharing updates from its Mobileye business, including a <a class="" href="https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fyoutu.be%2F-kNUVM8s0nc&esheet=52154089&newsitemid=20200106006026&lan=en-US&anchor=demonstration&index=1&md5=50ec149055b520ead942414bb3e69a0f" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" Swan also highlighted <a class="" href="https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewsroom.intel.com%2Fnews%2Famerican-red-cross-intel-use-ai-disaster-preparedness%2F&esheet=52154089&newsitemid=20200106006026&lan=en-US&anchor=Intel%27s+work+with+the+American+Red+Cross+and+its+Missing+Maps+project&index=3&md5=5903ec4bd9b35cd7f91aec2474f47699" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"   “At Intel, our ambition is to help customers make the most of technology inflections like AI, 5G and the intelligent edge so that together we can enrich lives and shape the world for decades to come.
As we highlighted today, our drive to infuse intelligence into every aspect of computing can have positive impact at unprecedented scale,” Swan said.

<em Mobile computing was an area of emphasis, as Intel made announcements spanning new products, partnerships and exciting platform-level innovations that will transform the way people focus, create and engage.

Intel Executive Vice President Gregory Bryant announced the following:     <em The data center is the force that delivers intelligence to businesses around the world and Intel Xeon Scalable processors continue to be the foundation of the data center.

Intel Executive Vice President Navin Shenoy announced that 3rd Generation Intel Xeon Scalable processors, coming in the first half of 2020, will include new Intel® DL Boost extensions for built-in AI training acceleration, providing up to a 60% increase in training performance over the previous family.

Shenoy highlighted several ways Intel is threading intelligence into data platforms across cloud, network and edge and how this is transforming sports and entertainment:     More information on all of these announcements, including visual assets from the event, is available in the <a class="" href="https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewsroom.intel.com%2Fpress-kits%2F2020-ces%2F&esheet=52154089&newsitemid=20200106006026&lan=en-US&anchor=CES+press+kit+on+the+Intel+Newsroom&index=4&md5=656ce61cc1d18e5ca7fd7b0fbcae7ef7" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" <em Intel (NASDAQ: INTC), a leader in the semiconductor industry, is shaping the data-centric future with computing and communications technology that is the foundation of the world’s innovations.

The company’s engineering expertise is helping address the world’s greatest challenges as well as helping secure, power and connect billions of devices and the infrastructure of the smart, connected world – from the cloud to the network to the edge and everything in between.
